Line 8: Line 8:
His first step as Evening Standard editor was to launch a series of "Sorry" advertisements across London, after market research showed the paper was deemed too negative and complacent about London under former editor [[Veronica Wadley]]'s leadership, a move considered to be extremely daring.<ref>[http://www.campaignlive.co.uk/news/rss/902948/London-Evening-Standard-says-sorry-Londoners-relaunch-campaign/ London Evening Standard says sorry to Londoners in relaunch campaign] campaignlive.co.uk, 5 May 2009</ref>
His first step as Evening Standard editor was to launch a series of "Sorry" advertisements across London, after market research showed the paper was deemed too negative and complacent about London under former editor [[Veronica Wadley]]'s leadership, a move considered to be extremely daring.<ref>[http://www.campaignlive.co.uk/news/rss/902948/London-Evening-Standard-says-sorry-Londoners-relaunch-campaign/ London Evening Standard says sorry to Londoners in relaunch campaign] campaignlive.co.uk, 5 May 2009</ref>
